intro: Rhexia latevenosa, commonly known as the late evening rhododendron, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas, preferring partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer to early fall. Rhexia latevenosa is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
